utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, Ross, I realise that you didn't expect to walk in and see that, but.. Let me explain, okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We weren't doing anything!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach, he just saw us.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Shhh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But what you saw, that is the extent of it, okay? One kiss.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, come on, that is a lie. We also kissed in Barbados.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, you started it! I've got to chill.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, we probably should have talked to you about this before it ever happened, but..

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We feel so terrible about this, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but it did happen, so...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross? Can we just close the door?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, say something. Anything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So you two are..?

utterance.speaker: Joey and Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And have you .. ed?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, no!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But if I hadn't walked in here, would you..?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Probably.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, this is not how we wanted you to find out about this. You have every right to go nuts.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm not going nuts. Do you see me go nuts?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, but you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey... If you two are happy, then I'm happy for you. I'm fine!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Absolutely. I'm fine! Totally fine. I don't know why it's coming out all loud and squeaky, 'cause really, I'm fine. I'm not saying I wasn't a little surprised to see you guys kissing. I mean, at first I was like.. But now that I've had time to absorb it; Lovin' this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's all working out! Me Charlie, and you two. You know what we should do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Calm ourselves?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. We should all have dinner. Yes, we'll do it tomorrow night. I'll cook!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, don't you think that will be a little weird?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Weird? What? What's weird? The only thing weird would be if someone didn't like Mexican food, because I'm making fajitas!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I do like fajitas.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: God, this adoption stuff is so overwhelming. There's inter-country adoption, dependency adoption.. There are so many ways to go, and this is like the biggest decision of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There's a hair in my coffee.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, have you seen Frank Jr., 'cause he's meeting me here with the triplets.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, it's funny. Every time you say "triplets," I immediately think of three hot blonde 19-year olds.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's sweet. Drink your hair.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, what's all this stuff?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, they're brochures from different adoption agencies.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, babies! Oh, this one is so cute, get this one!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's not really how it works.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, how does it work?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, if you're having a hard time, you should talk to my friends, Bill and Colleen. They adopted a kid. I'm sure they'd help you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks, that would be great. Hey, honey, wouldn't that be great?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Alright, alright, alright. Remember what we talked about. When we're in a public place, there are certain rules.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: That's not what we talked about!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Good to see you, too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi Frank.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Hi, how you doin'?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness, they've all gotten so big!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Which one is which again?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, that's Frank Jr. Jr. pulling the tampons out of the lady's purse. And that's Chandler climbing on Chandler, and that's Leslie throwing bagels at him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, can I just say I know we're doing this for Ross, and that's cool, but if it was up to me, this is not what we'd be doing on our first date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, what would we be doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'd take you out for a romantic night. Some champagne, fancy dinner, feel you up on the carriage ride home...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Feel me up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: In a carriage!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Charlie!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Hi, hi. So.. Dreading this?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you bet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, did you bring a little something for Ross?

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Actually.. It's stuff you left at my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: And you know, you can just give me my stuff whenever you want.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I didn't throw any of that out..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I thought I heard voices! Hi Charlie! Hi Joey. And.. Oh! You're gonna have to introduce me to your new girlfriend. I'm just kidding, I know Rachel, I know. Come, please come in. Come in.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, well, we brought you some wine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! That is so thoughtful. She's a keeper. And what did you bring me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, actually, that's..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Underwear, a toothbrush, and Van Halen CD. I can use all these things!!

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Gosh, Ross, you know, you seem a little...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Fine? Because I am! Aren't you? Aren't you? Aren't you? You see? Who else is fine?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, listen, hey, Ross. Why don't you try to relax, okay? Maybe have a drink.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what? That is a very good idea. I'm gonna go make a pitcher of Margaritas.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, god. So adorable. Look at them sleeping there like angels.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Yeah, I really cherish these moments, 'cause before you know it, they're gonna be awake again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, they may be a handful, but they're so cute.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, god, the last time I babysat them, they did the funniest thing..

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: I haven't slept in four years!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That's a, that's a long time.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: You just don't know how hard it is, Phoebe. There's just so many of them. You know, two I can handle. Two's great. You just hold one in each hand, but what do I do when the third one runs at me with his bike helmet on. I've got no more hands to protect my area! There's three of them, Phoebe, three!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, Frank. I counted them when they were coming out of my area.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Sometimes I think that.. Oh, no, no, no, I can't say it, it's too horrible. No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: No, I can't.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my god, Frank, are you thinking of leaving? Because I didn't have those triplets so you could just run out on them!

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, no! I would never do that. No. I just was thinking that, you know, maybe you could take one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! You can't separate them! That's terrible. Which one?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you so much for seeing us. Phoebe has told us such great things about you guys.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Oh, please, we're happy to help.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: We went through the same thing when we were adopting.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, a lot of malfunctioning wee-wees and hoo-hoos in this room, huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I mean, you have a lovely home.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, we appreciate anything you can tell us.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Well, actually, I think this might help.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: It's pretty much all the information you need.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god!

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Everything is broken down into categories, and then cross-referenced, and then colour-coded to correspond with the forms in the back.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you. I think I just had a tiny orgasm.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: I know the process is frustrating, but it's so worth it. Adopting Owen was the best thing that ever happened to us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's great. Can I see the book?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You want me to wash my hands first, don't you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's.. It's just so pretty and white.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: The bathroom is down the hall, to your left.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I would have told him to do it too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can I adopt you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you must be Owen.

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm Chandler. Hey, I was in the scouts too.

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: You were?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, in fact my father was a den-mother.

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know how to use a compass?

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: I have a badge in it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You do? That's fantastic!

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: You wanna see it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'd love to, but I gotta get back to talking to your parents. They're telling us all about how they adopted you.

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: What?!?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: I'm adopted?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I got nothing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The first batch of margaritas was not so great, but the second batch is gooooood.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, maybe the next batch, we could all get some.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, guys, this is fun, isn't it? You know? Just the four of us. Just hangin'.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, are you okay? And when are the fajitas gonna be ready?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm fine! Hey, I'm great! I'm just.. I'm just proud of us. There's no weirdness, no tension.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No awareness.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We make a great foursome. We should do more stuff together. Ooh! Let's take a trip. Okay, where do you think we - we can go?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My fajitas!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, Charlie, I just want you to know. Ross is just having a little trouble adjusting to the thought of Joey and me. You know, he normally doesn't drink like this.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Oh, you know what? This is nothing. My father is a raging alcoholic.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, have I made this evening uncomfortable?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fajitas! Be careful, very hot plate, very hot plate!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, you don't even have oven mitts on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That is gonna hurt tomorrow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well, this is crazy. Can't seriously be talking about me taking one of your kids, can we?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: No, of course we're not.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Insane.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alice would never go for it, right?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, I don't know, she's pretty tired, too, I think we've got her onboard.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, just you know, for argument's sake, you know, hypothetically. Which one would you be willing to give up?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Frank Jr.Jr.?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, you'd be getting a really good one. I mean, you know, he's really funny. Like, the other day he made up this joke.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: What's green and says "hey, I'm a frog"? A talking frog! Oh, no, you can't have him, he's too funny.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, alright, that's fine. What about Leslie?

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. Not Leslie. No, she's, she's the only one that knows how to burp the alphabet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alright, so that leaves Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, you can't have Chandler, no. No, no. She's my little genius. I got big hopes for her. She's gonna be a doctor or a realtor..

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, Frank. I think we just ran out of kids.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: Oh, I think you're right. Oh, wow. Phoebe, I don't think I can give one of them up. I mean, you know, they drive me crazy, but they're my babies.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Frank. I didn't realise things were so bad. You know, I'll help out more. I can - I can babysit any time you want. You name the day, and I'll be there.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: How about tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, that's not good. But you know, I can move some stuff around, and I'll be there. You and Alice just take the whole day together.

utterance.speaker: Frank Jr.
utterance.content: You'd do that for us?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you kidding? That's what sisters are for.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where are Bill and Colleen?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They're in the kitchen getting something to eat. Can you believe how nice they are?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We have to leave!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why? What did you do in the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I didn't get to the bathroom. I bumped into Owen on the way, and he didn't know he was adopted. And there's a slight chance I may have told him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god, where's my purse? No, you know what? I can replace everything in there. Get that binder, and let's go!

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: Some little snacks for everybody. Oh, you don't have to eat the sour worms. Those are for Owen.

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: I'll go get him in a second. By the way, you should know we haven't told him he's adopted yet.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But kids are so intuitive. Don't you think on some level he already knows?

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: I'm adopted?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See? Intuitive!

utterance.speaker: Bill
utterance.content: What? Where did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: He told me! And he paid me 50 dollars not to tell.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Which technically now you should give back!

utterance.speaker: Colleen
utterance.content: You told him he's adopted?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm so sorry, but you should have a sign out there or something. Or at least whisper it to people when they come in the door. "Owen doesn't know he's adopted, and he also thinks that Santa is real."

utterance.speaker: Owen
utterance.content: He isn't?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Everyone? I would like to make a toast to Rachel and Joey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And to love. Ah, love. L-O-V-E, love. L is for life. And what is life without love?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god, are we supposed to answer?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: O is for "oh, wow!" The V is for this very surprising turn of events, which I'm still fine with by the way. E is for how extremely normal I find it. That you two are together. And now one day you might get married and have children of your own.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Totally.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, you don't seem okay.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Wait, Ross. Ross. I - I have to take off.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I have a really early class in the morning, but this has been lovely.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wasn't it? And you thought it would be awkward with Joey and that you never really liked Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: You're on fire! I'll call you in the morning, okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: God, Rachel, what Ross just said that is just so..

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that's okay, girls tend not to like me.

utterance.speaker: Charlie
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I guess it's just flan for three! Hey, hey, that rhymed!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know what, Ross? I think we're gonna take off too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, oh. Of course. God, I'm so stupid. You guys are a couple now. I mean, you probably just want to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, it's just that it's getting late...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, it's fine. It's totally fine. We've got plenty of margaritas. It's all good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't even know what that's for.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know what? I think I'm gonna stay here and make sure he's okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, that's probably a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. I'll see you in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Okay. You know what, Joey, I don't think he's ever gonna be okay with this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It doesn't look good, does it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Morning. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks. Did you stay here all night?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So you took off my pants and shoes?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no. You actually did that when you were dancing to the Chicago-soundtrack. Look, Ross, about, about Rachel and I. Listen, you don't have to worry about that, okay? Because nothing is gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, she and I said from the beginning that we weren't gonna do anything unless you were okay with it. And clearly..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, what are you talking about? I'm fine!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's okay, Ross, alright? I totally understand. Of course you're not fine. You're.. You're Ross and Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Except we're not. I mean, we haven't been a couple in like, six years. Oh my god, is that right? Has it been that long?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's what I hear, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is crazy. I mean, six years? And because of me you guys aren't gonna be together? Can I ask you something? Really, what is this thing with you and Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on, I mean, you know me, you know...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm crazy about her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And she feels the same way?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, then, maybe it's time we all moved on.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but, Ross, I mean, you're not okay with it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, but I wanna be. Hey, I will be. Besides, I'm with Charlie, right? Oh my god, I'm still with Charlie, aren't I? I mean, she didn't see the dance, did she?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, that was - that was just for me. Are you sure about this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm sure.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And we're okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Phoebs

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uhm, we just wanna give you a heads-up. Bill and Colleen hate us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Owen didn't know he was adopted, and Monica told him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Still, he had to find out sometime.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, but how would you like it if someone told the triplets that you gave birth to them?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm gonna go tell Emma she was an accident.
